net.fec.openrq

Class OpenRQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.OpenRQ

  • public final class OpenRQ
extends Object
    The entry point for the OpenRQ API.

    This class provides methods for creating encoder objects from source data and FEC parameters, and methods for creating decoder objects that decode source data according to FEC parameters.

    This class also provides miscellaneous utility methods.

    • Method Detail

      • newEncoder

        public static ArrayDataEncoder newEncoder(byte[] data,
                          FECParameters fecParams)
        Returns a DataEncoder object with an array of bytes as the source data, configured according to the provided FEC parameters.

        Note that the maximum supported data length is Integer.MAX_VALUE.

        Parameters:
        fecParams - FEC parameters that configure the returned data encoder object
        data - An array of bytes containing the source data to be encoded
        Returns:
        a data encoder object backed by an array of bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If data or fecParams are null
        IllegalArgumentException - If fecParams.dataLength() > Integer.MAX_VALUE
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If fecParams.dataLength() > data.length

      • newEncoder

        public static ArrayDataEncoder newEncoder(byte[] data,
                          int offset,
                          FECParameters fecParams)
        Returns a DataEncoder object with an array of bytes as the source data, configured according to the provided FEC parameters.

        Note that the maximum supported data length is Integer.MAX_VALUE.

        Parameters:
        fecParams - FEC parameters that configure the returned data encoder object
        data - An array of bytes containing the source data to be encoded
        offset - The index in the array where the source data begins
        Returns:
        a data encoder object backed by an array of bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If data or fecParams are null
        IllegalArgumentException - If fecParams.dataLength() > Integer.MAX_VALUE
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If offset < 0 || fecParams.dataLength() > (data.length - offset)

      • newDecoder

        public static ArrayDataDecoder newDecoder(FECParameters fecParams,
                          int extraSymbols)
        Returns a DataDecoder object that decodes source data into an array of bytes, configured according to the provided FEC parameters and repair symbol overhead.

        The repair symbol overhead is given as a number of extra repair symbols that add up together with the amount of source symbols as the total number of encoding symbols that trigger a decoding operation. The larger the symbol overhead, the less likely is a decoding failure to occur, at the cost of more data to be transmitted. Naturally, this only applies when some source symbols are missing and repair symbols are available to substitute them.

        Note that the maximum supported data length is Integer.MAX_VALUE.

        Parameters:
        fecParams - FEC parameters that configure the returned data decoder object
        extraSymbols - Repair symbol overhead (must be non-negative)
        Returns:
        a data decoder object that decodes source data into an array of bytes
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If fecParams is null
        IllegalArgumentException - If fecParams.dataLength() > Integer.MAX_VALUE || extraSymbols < 0

      • minRepairSymbols

        public static final int minRepairSymbols(int numSourceSymbols,
                   int extraSymbols,
                   double loss)
        Calculates the minimum number of repair symbols from a source block to be transmitted for a given network loss rate.
        Parameters:
        numSourceSymbols - The number of source symbols in the source block (must be positive)
        extraSymbols - Number of extra repair symbols necessary for decoding (must be non-negative)
        loss - The expected network loss rate (must be between 0 and 1).
        Returns:
        the minimum number of repair symbols that should be transmitted
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If numSourceSymbols, extraSymbols or loss are out of bounds
